sublessons.title: (Part 1) Nice to meet you
phrases: 初[はじ]めまして
explanations: 初[はじ]めまして rougly translates to 'nice to meet you for the first time'
It is commonly used as the first sentence when introducing yourself

sublessons.title: (Part 2) My name is ...
phrases: 私[わたし]は ...です
explanations: 私[わたし]は ...です means 'my name is ...です'
です is added at the end to show politeness
Sometimes, 私[わたし]は is omitted as when it is obvious that you are referring to yourself
It is commonly used as the second sentence when introducing yourself

sublessons.title: (Part 3) I will be in your care
phrases: どうぞ よるしく
explanations: どうぞ よるしく does not really have a proper english translation and is almost like a request for the other person to be kind towards you
It is commonly used as the last sentence when introducing yourself

sublessons.title: Good Morning
phrases: お早[はよ]う
お早[はよ]う ございま
explanations: お早[はよ]う means 'good morning'
お早[はよ]う ございます also means 'good morning' but is more polite

sublessons.title: Good Afternoon
phrases: 今日[こんにち]は
explanations: 今日[こんにち]は means 'good afternoon'
[Note] は here is pronounced as わ

sublessons.title: Good Evening
phrases: 今晩[こんばん]は
explanations: 今晩[こんばん]は means 'good evening'
[Note] は here is pronounced as わ

sublessons.title: Goodbye/Farewell
phrases: さようなら
じゃあね
またね
explanations: さようなら means 'goodbye' but is more formal and akin to farewell where you might not see the other party for a long time again
じゃあね means 'see you' and is used casually among friends
またね means 'later' and is also used casually among friends

sublessons.title: Goodnight
phrases: お休[やす]み
お休[やす]みなさい
explanations: お休[やす]み means 'goodnight'
お休[やす]みなさい also means 'goodnight' but is more polite

sublessons.title: Thank you
phrases: 有[あ]り難[がと]う
有[あ]り難[がと]う ございます
どうも
explanations: 有[あ]り難[がと]う means 'thank you'
有[あ]り難[がと]う ございます is a more polite form of showing appreciation
どうも is the casual form of saying thanks

sublessons.title: You're welcome
phrases: どういたしまして
explanations: どういたしまして means 'you're welcome'

sublessons.title: Excuse me/Sorry/Thanks
phrases: すみません
explanations: すみません is a versatile word that can be used to grab someone's attention, apologise for a small error or show appreciation

sublessons.title: Not at all
phrases: いいえ
explanations: いいえ means 'No'
It can be used as a reply to すみません, when someone expresses gratitude or an apology towards you

sublessons.title: I'm going out and coming back
phrases: 行[い]ってきます
explanations: 行[い]ってきます means that you are leaving but implies that you will be coming back
It can be used amongst family or colleagues when leaving home or the office

sublessons.title: See you! Take care
phrases: 行[い]ってらっしゃい
explanations: 行[い]ってらっしゃい is directly translated to 'go and come back' but it's meaning is closer to 'see you later' or 'take care'
It is used as reply phrase to someone saying 行[い]ってきます

sublessons.title: I'm back
phrases: ただ今[いま]
explanations: ただ今[いま] is used to annouce your return to somewhere

sublessons.title: Welcome home
phrases: お帰[かえ]りなさい
explanations: お帰[かえ]りなさい means welcome home and is used as a reply to ただ今[いま]
It can also be shortened to お帰[かえ]り

sublessons.title: How long will it take approximately?
phrases: 何[どの]位[ぐらい]掛[か]かります?

sublessons.title: What time does it start/open and end/close?
phrases: 何[なん]時[じ]から何[なん]時[じ]までですか?

sublessons.title: This/That/That over there
phrases: これ
それ
あれ
explanation: これ refers to something near the speaker
それ refers to something near the listener
あれ refers to something distant from both the speaker and listener

sublessons.title: This thing/That thing/That thing over there
phrases: この...(noun)
その...(noun)
あの...(noun)
explanation: この...(noun) refers to a (noun) near the speaker
その...(noun) refers to a (noun) near the listener
あの...(noun) refers to a (noun) distant from both the speaker and listener

sublessons.title: Here/There/Over there
phrases: ここ
そこ
あそこ
explanation: ここ refers to a place near the speaker
そこ refers to a place near the listener
あそこ refers to a place distant from both the speaker and listener

sublessons.title: Is there a washroom? Where is it?
phrases: トイレはありますか? どこですか?
洗[せん]面[めん]所[じょ]はありますか? どこですか?

sublessons.title: Does this train stop at... (station name)?
phrases: この電[でん]車[しゃ]は... (station name)に 停[てい]車[しゃ]しますか？

sublessons.title: How much does that (thing) cost?
phrases: それはいくらですか?

sublessons.title: Can I pay by Suica or credit card?
phrases: Suica又[また]はクレジットカードで払[はら]っていいですか？

sublessons.title: Sorry. Only cash
phrases: すみません。現[げん]金[きん]のみとです

sublessons.title: Is there Tax Refund?
phrases: 還[かん]付[ぷ]税[ぜい]はありますか?

sublessons.title: How many people are in your group?
phrases: 何[なん]名[めい]様[さま]ですか?

sublessons.title: Nine people. Separate table is OK
phrases: 九[きゅう]人[にん]です。別[べつ]テーブル OK です。

sublessons.title: Do you have a reservation?
phrases: ご予[よ]約[やく]はされているん でしょうか?

sublessons.title: Yes I made a reservation, it is booked under ...
phrases: 予[よ]約[やく]をしています。...です。

sublessons.title: Sorry, I haven't, are there any seats/spaces available?
phrases: すみません、予[よ]約[やく]してないのですが, 空[あ]いていますか？

sublessons.title: Sorry, we are full now (No seat available)
phrases: 申[もう]し訳[わけ]ございません。只[ただ]今[いま]、満[まん]席[せき] となっております

sublessons.title: Do you have an english menu?
phrases: 英[えい]語[ご]メニューはありますか？

sublessons.title: What is your recommendation?
phrases: お勧[すす]めは何[なん]ですか?

sublessons.title: Excuse me, I'll like to order
phrases: すみません, 注[ちゅう]文[もん]をお願[ねが]いします

sublessons.title: Please wait a moment
phrases: 少[しょう]々[しょう]お待[ま]ち下[くだ]さい

sublessons.title: Does this have shellfish?
phrases: これに貝[かい]類[るい]入っていますか?

sublessons.title: Do you have set meals?
phrases: 定[てい]食[しょく]ありますか?

sublessons.title: I would like a glass of beer please
phrases: ビールを一[いっ]杯[ぱい]お願[ねが]いします

sublessons.title: Thank you for the meal (Before eating)
phrases: いだだきます
explanations: いだだきます express gratitude and is said before eating

sublessons.title: Excuse me, could we get the bill/check, please
phrases: すみません, お会[かい]計[けい]をお願[ねが]いします
すみません, チェックをお願[ねが]いします

sublessons.title: Thank you for the meal (After eating)
phrases: ごちそうさまでした
explanations: ごちそうさまでした express gratitude and is said after eating

sublessons.title: Are you Chinese (Nationality)
phrases: 中[ちゅう]国[ごく]人[じん]ですか?

sublessons.title: No. I'm Singaporean
phrases: いいえ，違[ちが]う。シンガポール人[じん]です

sublessons.title: Where are you from?
phrases: 出[しゅっ]身[しん]はどこですか?

sublessons.title: I'm from Singapore. I'm on holiday now so I'm travelling
phrases: シンガポールから来[き]ました. 今[いま]休[きゅう]暇[か]中[ちゅう]なので旅[りょ]行[こう]に行[い]っています

sublessons.title: What is your occupation?
phrases: 仕[し]事[ごと]は何[なん]ですか?

sublessons.title: I'm a programmer
phrases: プログラマーです

sublessons.title: How long have you been working
phrases: 何[なん]年[ねん]働[はたら]いているのか?

sublessons.title: About 3 years
phrases: 三[さん]年[ねん]ぐらいです

sublessons.title: What is your favorite Japanese cuisine?
phrases: 一[いち]番[ばん]日[に]本[ほん]料[りょう]理[り]は 何[なん]ですか?

sublessons.title: Me too. Do you know of any good shops to recommend?
phrases: 私も。お勧[すす]めの店[みせ]を知[し]りますか?

sublessons.title: What kind of hobbies do you do?
phrases: どんな趣[しゅ]味[み]はしましたか?

sublessons.title: Please Help
phrases: 手て伝[つだ]って下[くだ]さい

sublessons.title: I lost my bag
phrases: 鞄[かばん]をなくしました

sublessons.title: I dropped my wallet
phrases: 財[さい]布[ふ]をおとしました

sublessons.title: Please take me to the Hospital
phrases: 病[びょう]院[いん]に連[つ]れていって下[くだ]さい
